## {{spp_name_informal_sen}} (*{{spp_name_scientific}}*)

{{spp_name_informal_sen}} was the `r scales::ordinal({{xth}})` most abundant species caught in the {{year}} {{region}} survey (Table \@ref(tab:top-cpue)). The highest densities were recorded in the {{inpfc_highest_cpue}} and {{inpfc_2nd_highest_cpue}} (Figure `r officer::run_reference(paste0("cpue-",{{species_code}}))` and  Table `r officer::run_reference(paste0("table1-",{{species_code}}))`). {{middle_sentences}} On average, the largest individuals were found in the {{region_largest}} (Table `r officer::run_reference(paste0("lengthdepth-",{{species_code}}))`). The total biomass of {{spp_name_informal}} in the {{year}} {{survname_long}} bottom trawl survey was estimated to be {{species_biomass}} t. 

The largest estimated biomass for {{spp_name_informal}} was in the {{inpfc_highest_biomass}} (Figure `r officer::run_reference(paste0("cpue-",{{species_code}}))` and Table `r officer::run_reference(paste0("table1-",{{species_code}}))`). Length distributions by year are provided in Figure `r officer::run_reference(paste0("lengthcomp-",{{species_code}}))`.
